jhelp.util.math.random

Class JHelpRandom<CHOICE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jhelp.util.math.random.JHelpRandom<CHOICE>
  • Type Parameters:
    CHOICE - Choice type

    public final class JHelpRandom<CHOICE>
extends java.lang.Object
    Able to choice an object randomly.
    The chance to have an object can be different than to have an& nbsp;other one.
    For example if "A" have 50% chance, "B" 25%, "C" 12%, "D" 6%,"E" 3%, "F" 2%, "G" 1% and "H" 1% :
    After each time you do
    Choice have 50% chance to be "A",
    25% chance to be "B",
    12% chance to be "C",
    6% chance to be "D",
    3% chance to be "E",
    2% chance to be "F",
    1% chance to be "G" and
    1% chance to be "H"

    You can also see things like this, you have a set of element compose of 55 "P" and 87 "R" :
    After each time you do
    Choice have 55 chance of 142 to be "P" and 87 chance of 142 to be "R"
    Author:
    JHelp
